Financial sustainability : the project will be mainstreamed in the co-curricular activities of the schools. Therefore, the financing of management and maintenance procedures will be covered through these activities and the school will arrange fund raising activities from parents whenever necessary. Forster sanitation and hygiene behavioural and attitude change through student involvement and awareness raising. Specific objectives;
To facilitate access to basic WASH facilities for 2 primary schools To engage 1,623 students and 47 teachers in 2 primary schools in student hygiene and school sanitation activities To mainstream SLSSH in 2 school co-curricular activities To convince 24 education sector government bodies on the importance of the SLSSH

Moreover; some of the latrines of the schools are not enough to serve the number of enrolled students. This situation obviously forces students to practice open defection in the school compound while latrines of some other schools do not have water connection. In such situations the school students are likely to be infested with parasitic infections which result in students’ drop-out and regular absenteeism.

Student-Led School Sanitation and Hygiene (SLSSH) is a school sanitation and hygiene improvement program designed whereby students take the lead of their school sanitation and hygiene implementation. It is the students that initiate and lead change processes by establishing their own committees and setting their own bylaws to excel their school compound hygiene and sanitation implementation.

The water supply and sanitation facilities constructed in both schools have most of the materials from the local market. They are constructed using local labor therefore, they can be easily replicated to other schools in the surrounding.
